item.title: New Atomfall Trailer Shows Game’s Features
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/new-atomfall-trailer-shows-games-features/

Developer Rebellion has released a brand new features trailer for the upcoming action survival game, Atomfall. In this trailer, players get a look at various settings and landscapes in the game while also learning about what to expect as you play.

“This slice of Northern England includes everything from open moors, rugged hills, dense woodlands and the picture-perfect English village Wyndham,” Rebellion says. “But beware, this is a dangerous and hostile landscape filled with gangs of outlaws, crazed cultists and unexplained horrors.

“Even the local wildlife poses an immense threat to your life. If you are to navigate this land and survive, you will need to fight for your life and scavenge resources.”

You can check out the full trailer for yourself below.

Atomfall launches on March 27, and will be available on PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC. The game will also launch Day One on Xbox Game Pass.

In his preview of the game last summer, Insider Gaming’s Grant Taylor-Hill touched on how interacting with the game’s characters can change your overall experience.

“Get too close to a faction that doesn’t trust you, and you’ll be set upon pretty quickly,” he said. “In conversations, you can choose from what might be several choices, each of which can lead a different way. If you want to be stealthier, you’ll put enemies on edge, and if you go in guns blazing, you’ll quickly draw an entire force down upon you.”

What do you think of the latest look at Atomfall? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what classic Call of Duty game is scheduled to come to Xbox Game Pass in the coming months, and see what studio former Activision CEO Bobby Kotick regrets acquiring. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter

item.title: The Alters Has Been Delayed Again By 11 Bit Stdios
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-alters-has-been-delayed-again-by-11-bit-stdios/

The Alters has been delayed once again by 11 Bit Studios. The announcement comes via a post on social media on Wednesday morning.

In the post online, the game’s official account said that the planned release for Q1 2025 has been pushed to later in the year. An exact window, however, wasn’t given.

“While we recognize that this may not be the update you were hoping for, this additional time is being dedicated to further refining mission parameters and ensuring that all essential systems meet Ally Corp’s uncompromising standards,” the statement reads. “Furthermore, it is also allowing us to integrate new enhancements into Project Dolly, ensuring that your eventual deployment is more exciting and rewarding than originally projected.”

They continued: “This additional time will allow us to ensure that every aspect of Project Dolly operates at peak efficiency, leading to an outcome that benefits both the organization and, of course, yourself.”

For those unfamiliar with the game, The Alters is a “emotional sci-fi game with a unique blend of survival, adventure, and base-building elements.” Players have to work to create alternate versions of the main character Jan Dolski in order to escape a hostile planet after he was left as the lone survivor of a space expedition.

The game was announced back in June 2022. When it does finally release, The Alters will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. It will also be available via Xbox Game Pass.

What do you make of The Alters being delayed to later this year? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Release Date Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/elden-ring-nightreign-release-date-announced/

FromSoftware and Bandai Namco have announced the release date for Elden Ring Nightreign. The game is set to launch on May 30, 2025 and will retail for $40 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC.

The news off the release date confirms an earlier Insider Gaming exclusive that more information on the game was scheduled for this week.

In addition to the release date confirmation, the studio also released a new trailer for Elden Ring Nightreign, showing off more gameplay from the upcoming co-op title.

Network Test Sessions Soon

With the Elden Ring Nightreign release date confirmed, the next step is the network playtest for the game. Starting February 14, those who were selected for participation will be able to play a small portion of the game.

“This large-scale Network Stress Test is designed to evaluate various aspects of the online system’s functionality and performance,” Bandai Namco said. “We are looking forward to your cooperation to make Elden Ring Nightreign even better.”

The network tests will start on February 14 and run through the weekend at various times. Those include:

  • February 14: 6am-9am ET / 3am-6am PT
  • February 14: 10pm-1am ET / 7pm-10pm PT
  • February 15: 2pm-5pm ET / 11am-2pm PT
  • February 16: 6am-9am ET / 3am-6am PT
  • February 16: 10pm-1am ET / 7pm-10pm PT

First announced at The Game Awards 2024 in December, Elden Ring Nightreign is a co-op spin-off game for three players set in the Elden Ring universe.

What’s your excitement level for Elden Ring Nightreign now that we have its official release date? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.
